page.title: 13The "Trunce"
page.content: The{"Trunce"}is the name given to a short cross-country run held every third Monday evening during the summer.The unusual name comes from the farm of the same name that the race passes through.The race starts and finishes at Oxspring ,winding up and down the banks of,and crossing (four times) the River Don,often using stepping-stones,which,depending on the recent weather,may not be visible! The race regularly attracts over 100 runners of all ages,who compete for positions in a league table.Points are gained for a top-20 placing,and also for improving on a personal best time. The final race of the year is a light-hearted affair,with competitors running in fancy dress costumes.A two- man pantomime horse is thought to hold one of the fastest times for an animal of this kind!
